# SOLUTION
# Assume the array is of even length.
# If the length is odd, then the array cannot be made good.
# If the length is even, then we can always make the array good by swapping
# the elements at indices i and i+1 for all i.

# Python 2/3 compatibility
from __future__ import print_function

# Read the number of test cases
T = int(input())

# Iterate over the test cases
for t in range(T):
    # Read the number of elements in the array
    N = int(input())
    
    # If the array has odd length, then print -1
    if N % 2 == 1:
        print(-1)
        continue
    
    # Else, print 0
    print(0)
